content.question: Which of the following best explains an implication of the authors’ argument for the legitimacy of Iran’s current regime?

choices.label: The regime’s legitimacy will weaken because of the supreme leader’s change from his traditionally neutral role in politics.
The regime’s legitimacy will weaken because of disapproval of the regime’s electoral practices by the global community.
The regime’s legitimacy will strengthen because of the regime’s repression of dissent against Ahmadinejad.
The regime’s legitimacy will strengthen because of Iranians’ fear that the Revolutionary Guards will harshly repress any protest.

content.answer: The regime’s legitimacy will weaken because of the supreme leader’s change from his traditionally neutral role in politics.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Explain how the implications of the author's argument or perspective may affect political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
